definition: extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: So, there is more useful purposes than that than just taking remainders.
sentences.chinese: 當然還有一些其他用途，不單單是取餘數。

sentences.english: Integers don't have fractions, and so the "remainder" is lopped off.
sentences.chinese: 整數沒有小數部分，所以餘數部分被砍掉了。

sentences.english: Take 4 from 9 and the remainder is 5.
Divides two numbers and returns the remainder.
sentences.chinese: 將兩個數相除並返回餘數。

sentences.english: Divides two numbers and assigns the remainder to the first argument.
sentences.chinese: 將兩個數相除，然後將餘數賦給第一個參數。

sentences.english: The original congruent number formula has been deduced by fundmental methods of number theory.
sentences.chinese: 通過運用初等數論方法，推導出本原同餘數公式。

sentences.english: The remainder from dividing the cksum value by the denom value.
sentences.chinese: 校驗和值除以分母值的餘數。

sentences.english: And, at some level, there is some redundancy here.
sentences.chinese: 在某種程度上說，這存在冗餘數。

sentences.english: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.
sentences.chinese: 如今也是這樣，照着揀選的恩典還有所留的餘數。

sentences.english: So, three divided by five is zero, with a remainder of three.
The second instruction above reconstructs the remainder.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第二條指令就重新產生了餘數。

definition: (of a sum of money etc) receivable
Yuan Haowen (1190-1257), famous poet Northern China during the Jin-Yuan transition
sum (result of addition)/addition/total/to add up a number of items/to accumulate
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
Imperial Readings of the Taiping Era, general Song dynasty encyclopedia compiled during 977-983 under Li Fang 李昉[Li3 Fang3], 1000 scrolls
to reduce/to lessen (pain etc)/to deduct (from taxes)
see 每況愈下|每况愈下[mei3 kuang4 yu4 xia4]
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
